title: CHURCH ORB / cone of silence
description: EVERYTHING IS SILENT HERE VERY SPOOKY SCENE YES INDEED WHOLE SCENE ABOUT LOOKING UP AND THEN TIAGO APPEARS, BOOM!

dialogueTree.title: Perception (Hearing): "The silence in this part of the chu..."
dialogueTree.english: The silence in this part of the church -- it's almost palpable. All the shifting matter and shuffling of living things is gone. Nothing seems to exist beyond the church anymore.
dialogueTree.polish: Cisza w tej części kościoła jest niemal namacalna. Wszelka poruszająca się materia i pełzające istoty żywe są tu nieobecne. Oprócz samego budynku nic zdaje się nie istnieć.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Цішыня ў гэтай частцы касцёла амаль адчувальная. Усякая рухомая матэрыя і поўзаючыя жывыя істоты тут адсутнічаюць. Акрамя самога будынка нічога, здаецца, не існуе.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Maybe if you were to stand in just..."
links.english: Maybe if you were to stand in just the right spot, even your footsteps would be completely silent...
links.polish: Może gdybyś stanął w odpowiednim miejscu, nawet twoje kroki nie wydawałyby żadnego odgłosu...?
links.belarusian: Можа, калі б ты стаў у адпаведным месцы, нават твае крокі не выдавалі б ніякага гуку...?

links.title: You: "Wait, I think I still hear somethin..."
links.english: Wait, I think I still hear something...
links.polish: Zaraz, chyba mimo to coś jeszcze słyszę...
links.belarusian: Пачакайце, здаецца, я ўсё роўна нешта чую...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "And then it's gone. Almost all of i..."
links.english: And then it's gone. Almost all of it -- but for the faintest of hums.
links.polish: A potem i to coś znika. Niemal wszystko poza najcichszym z szumów.
links.belarusian: А потым і гэта нешта знікае. Амаль усё знікае, акрамя найцішэйшага шуму.

links.title: Logic: "It seems that sound here is detache..."
links.english: It seems that sound here is detached from its source somehow, if not blotted out outright. Truly unusual.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że dźwięk jest tu jakoś oddzielany od źródła, o ile nie tłumiony od razu po jego wydaniu. Bardzo to nietypowe.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, што гук тут неяк аддзяляецца ад крыніцы, калі не заглушаецца адразу пасля яго выданне. Вельмі гэта нетыпова.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Sounds like the pale."
links.english: Sounds like the pale.
links.polish: Brzmi to jak szarota.
links.belarusian: Гэта гучыць, як арніка.

links.title: You: "How do I know what the pale sounds..."
links.english: How do I know what the pale sounds like?
links.polish: Skąd ja wiem, jak brzmi szarota?
links.belarusian: Адкуль я ведаю, як гучыць шчарытоўка?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "From recordings. Of the far pale. Y..."
links.english: From recordings. Of the far pale. You've heard them. We all have.
links.polish: Z nagrań. Odległej szaroty. Słyszałeś je. Jak my wszyscy.
links.belarusian: З запісаў. Адлеглай шараты. Ты чуў іх. Як мы ўсе.

links.title: You: "No. Let me just listen."
links.english: No. Let me just listen.
links.polish: Nie. Daj mi po prostu słuchać.
links.belarusian: Не. Дай мне проста слухаць.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "But to what? There is almost nothin..."
links.english: But to what? There is almost nothing.
links.polish: Ale czego? Prawie nic nie słychać.
links.belarusian: Але чаго? Амаль нічога не чуваць.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You can hardly hear your own breath..."
links.english: You can hardly hear your own breathing.
links.polish: Ledwo słyszysz swój własny oddech.
links.belarusian: Амаль не чуеш свайго ўласнага дыхання.

links.title: You: "Yell as loud as you can."
links.english: Yell as loud as you can.
links.polish: Krzyknij tak głośno, jak tylko możesz.
links.belarusian: Крычы так гучна, як толькі можаш.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Your voice is barely audible -- not..."
links.english: Your voice is barely audible -- not a howl, but the softest of whimpers.
links.polish: Twój głos jest ledwie słyszalny. Zamiast wyciem jest cichutkim jękiem.
links.belarusian: Твой голас ледзь чутны. Замест выцця гэта ціхенькі стогн.

links.title: Half Light: "It's unnerving."
links.english: It's unnerving.
links.polish: Bardzo niepokojące.
links.belarusian: Вельмі трывожна.

links.title: You: "Stomp your feet and clap your hands..."
links.english: Stomp your feet and clap your hands.
links.polish: Tupnij i zaklaszcz w dłonie.
links.belarusian: Тупніце і плясніце ў далоні.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You produce a few muffled thumps, a..."
links.english: You produce a few muffled thumps, after which the silence feels even more... *total* somehow.
links.polish: Udaje ci się wydać kilka stłumionych stuknięć, po których cisza wydaje się z jakiegoś powodu jeszcze bardziej... *absolutna*.
links.belarusian: Табе ўдаецца выдаць некалькі прыглухіх стукаў, пасля якіх цішыня здаецца па нейкай прычыне яшчэ больш... *абсалютнай*.

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "What's happening?""
links.english: (Turn to Kim.) "What's happening?"
links.polish: (Odwróć się do Kima). „Co się dzieje?”
links.belarusian: (Павярніся да Кіма). "Што адбываецца?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant points to his ears a..."
links.english: The lieutenant points to his ears and shakes his head. Then he leans closer.
links.polish: Porucznik wskazuje swoje uszy i kręci głową, po czym podchodzi do ciebie bliżej.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант паказвае на свае вушы і круціць галавой, пасля чаго падыходзіць да цябе бліжэй.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Can you hear anything?""
links.english: "Can you hear anything?"
links.polish: „Słyszysz coś?”
links.belarusian: "Чуеш што-небудзь?"

links.title: You: ""Almost nothing, and it's beginning..."
links.english: "Almost nothing, and it's beginning to worry me."
links.polish: „Prawie nic i zaczyna mnie to martwić”.
links.belarusian: "Амаль нічога, і гэта пачынае мяне турбаваць".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The church just has... strange aco..."
links.english: "The church just has... strange acoustics -- some engineering trick."
links.polish: „Ten kościół ma... dziwną akustykę – to musi być jakaś architektoniczna sztuczka”.
links.belarusian: "Гэты касцёл мае... дзіўную акустыку — гэта мусіць быць якаясьці архітэктурная штука".

links.title: Empathy: "His detached tone conceals how unco..."
links.english: His detached tone conceals how uncomfortable he is.
links.polish: Obojętnością w głosie ukrywa swój niepokój.
links.belarusian: Абыякавасцю ў голасе хавае сваю трывогу.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Maybe the church was designed in th..."
links.english: Maybe the church was designed in this way to prevent boisterous activity -- singing and dancing -- on its premises?
links.polish: Być może kościół zaprojektowano w ten sposób, aby zapobiec hałaśliwym rozrywkom na jego terenie, jak śpiew czy taniec?
links.belarusian: Магчыма, касцёл быў спраектаваны такім чынам, каб прадухіліць шумныя забавы на яго тэрыторыі, такія як спевы ці танцы?

links.title: You: ""Maybe they wanted to discourage si..."
links.english: "Maybe they wanted to discourage singing and dancing."
links.polish: „Może chcieli utrudnić tu ludziom śpiew i taniec?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, хацелі ўскладніць людзям тут спевы і танцы?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm, could be...""
links.english: "Hmm, could be..."
links.polish: „Hmm... Możliwe...”
links.belarusian: "Хмм... Магчыма..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't seem entirely convinced,..."
links.english: He doesn't seem entirely convinced, though.
links.polish: Nie wydaje się jednak do końca przekonany.
links.belarusian: Аднак ён не выглядае цалкам перакананым.

links.title: You: ""Hey, what if it's something *paran..."
links.english: "Hey, what if it's something *paranatural*?"
links.polish: „Hej, a jeśli to coś *paranaturalnego*?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй, а калі гэта нешта *паранатуральнае*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Please, detective, not this again.""
links.english: "Please, detective, not this again."
links.polish: „Proszę, detektywie, nie zaczynaj z tym znowu”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, дэтэктыве, не пачынайце гэта зноў".

links.title: Suggestion: "He's trying to act dismissive, but..."
links.english: He's trying to act dismissive, but at this particular moment, he's more open than usual to the idea of paranatural phenomena.
links.polish: Próbuje zabrzmieć lekceważąco, ale w tym konkretnym momencie jest bardziej niż zwykle otwarty na pomysł występowania tu zjawisk paranormalnych.
links.belarusian: Спрабуе гучаць пагардліва, але ў гэты канкрэтны момант ён больш чым звычайна адкрыты на ідэю існавання паранармальных з'яў тут.

links.title: You: ""It's probably nothing, just our im..."
links.english: "It's probably nothing, just our imagination."
links.polish: „To pewnie nic takiego, tylko nasza wyobraźnia”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта, напэўна, нічога такога, толькі наша ўяўленне".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm, maybe. Darkness often has tha..."
links.english: "Hmm, maybe. Darkness often has that effect on people."
links.polish: „Hmm... Możliwe. Ciemność często ma taki wpływ na ludzi”.
links.belarusian: "Хм... Магчыма. Цемра часта аказвае такі ўплыў на людзей".

links.title: You: ""Whatever it is, it's definitely re..."
links.english: "Whatever it is, it's definitely real. Something odd is happening around us."
links.polish: „Cokolwiek to jest, ewidentnie naprawdę ma miejsce. Dzieje się wokół nas coś dziwnego”.
links.belarusian: "Што б гэта ні было, яно сапраўды адбываецца. Вакол нас адбываецца нешта дзіўнае".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't reply, but y..."
links.english: The lieutenant doesn't reply, but you can sense him tense up next to you.
links.polish: Porucznik nie odpowiada, ale czujesz, że robi się spięty.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не адказвае, але ты адчуваеш, што ён становіцца напружаным.

links.title: You: ""Not really, but it's extraordinary..."
links.english: "Not really, but it's extraordinary. I've never experienced anything like this."
links.polish: „Nie bardzo, ale to niezwykłe. Nigdy czegoś podobnego nie doświadczyłem”.
links.belarusian: "Не вельмі, але гэта незвычайна. Ніколі не адчуваў нічога падобнага".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wonder why the... church was bui..."
links.english: "I wonder why the... church was built with such strange acoustics..."
links.polish: „Zastanawiam się, dlaczego... wzniesiono kościół z tak dziwną akustyką...”
links.belarusian: "Задумываюся, чаму… пабудавалі касцёл з такой дзіўнай акустыкай…"

links.title: You: ""Can't hear shit.""
links.english: "Can't hear shit."
links.polish: „Gówno słyszę”.
links.belarusian: "Гаўно чую".

links.title: You: "Look up into the bell tower."
links.english: Look up into the bell tower.
links.polish: Spójrz w górę, do wnętrza dzwonnicy.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі ўверх, унутр званіцы.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The orderly rows of ceiling panels..."
links.english: The orderly rows of ceiling panels become barely visible, then disappear completely in the darkness of the tower overhead.
links.polish: Zwarte szeregi paneli sufitowych zacierają się, a potem całkowicie znikają w mroku wieży nad twoją głową.
links.belarusian: Чорныя шэрагі потолкавых панэляў знікаюць, а потым цалкам знікаюць у цемры вежы над тваёй галавой.

links.title: You: "Try to see beyond the shadows."
links.english: Try to see beyond the shadows.
links.polish: Spróbuj przebić wzrokiem cienie.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуй прабіць вачыма цені.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It's like there's something moving..."
links.english: It's like there's something moving up there -- a shadow has emerged from the tower and is making its way *toward* you through all the other shadows.
links.polish: Jakby coś się tam ruszało, z wieży wyłonił się cień, który przenika wszystkie inne, zmierzając *ku tobie*.
links.belarusian: Як бы штосьці там рухалася, з вежы ўзнік цень, які пранікае праз усе іншыя, накіроўваючыся *да цябе*.

links.title: You: "On the ceiling?"
links.english: On the ceiling?
links.polish: Na suficie?
links.belarusian: На столі?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Yes. The darkness makes the ceiling..."
links.english: Yes. The darkness makes the ceiling feel infinitely far away...
links.polish: Tak. Mrok sprawia, że sufit ten wydaje się nieskończenie daleki...
links.belarusian: Так. Цемра робіць гэтую столь здаецца бясконца далёкай...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "It's *climbing*. Climbing down, hol..."
links.english: It's *climbing*. Climbing down, holding on the beams.
links.polish: *Schodzi na dół*. Trzymając się wsporników.
links.belarusian: *Спускаецца ўніз*. Трымаючыся за апоры.

links.title: You: "Follow the shadow's movements."
links.english: Follow the shadow's movements.
links.polish: Obserwuj ruchy cienia.
links.belarusian: Назірай за рухамі ценю.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It's not a shadow anymore -- becomi..."
links.english: It's not a shadow anymore -- becoming more substantial as it gets closer. The shape of an *animal* descends.
links.polish: To już nie jest cień. W miarę jak się zbliża, staje się coraz bardziej materialny. Zniża się ku tobie *zwierzęcy* kształt.
links.belarusian: Гэта больш не цень. Па меры набліжэння ён становіцца ўсё больш матэрыяльным. Схіляецца да цябе *жывёльная* форма.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, is there something up the..."
links.english: "Officer, is there something up there?" The lieutenant follows your gaze, attempting to see whatever it is that you are seeing.
links.polish: „Oficerze, czy tam na górze coś jest?” – pyta porucznik i podąża za twoim wzrokiem, próbując dostrzec to, co przykuło twoją uwagę.
links.belarusian: "Афіцэр, ці ёсць там наверсе што-небудзь?" — пытаецца лейтэнант і ідзе за тваім позіркам, спрабуючы ўбачыць тое, што прыцягнула тваю ўвагу.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Oh no! You've lost sight of it. Whe..."
links.english: Oh no! You've lost sight of it. Where did it go?
links.polish: O nie! Straciłeś go z oczu. Gdzie się podział?
links.belarusian: О не! Ты страціў яго з вачэй. Дзе ён падзеўся?

links.title: Half Light: "Prepare for an attack!"
links.english: Prepare for an attack!
links.polish: Przygotuj się na atak!
links.belarusian: Падрыхтуйся да нападу!

links.title: You: "(Blink.)"
links.english: (Blink.)
links.polish: (Mrugnij).
links.belarusian: (Міргні).

links.title: Tiago: "You see something hanging from the..."
links.english: You see something hanging from the rafters, looking straight at you with dark eyes.
links.polish: Widzisz coś zwisającego z krokwi, patrzącego na ciebie ciemnymi oczami.
links.belarusian: Вы бачыце нешта звісаючае з крокваў, глядзячае на вас цёмнымі вачыма.

links.title: Tiago: "Maybe it's possible to... talk to i..."
links.english: Maybe it's possible to... talk to it?
links.polish: Może dałoby się z tym... porozmawiać?
links.belarusian: Можа, удалося б пра гэта... паразмаўляць?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Just darkness without end -- it mak..."
links.english: Just darkness without end -- it makes your head spin.
links.polish: Jest tam tylko niekończący się mrok. Aż ci się kręci w głowie.
links.belarusian: Там толькі бясконцая цемра. Настолькі, што галава кружыцца.

links.title: You: "What's the darkness like?"
links.english: What's the darkness like?
links.polish: Jaki jest ten mrok?
links.belarusian: Які гэты цямнота?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Filled with vague shapes of woodwor..."
links.english: Filled with vague shapes of woodwork. The sense of a great height.
links.polish: Wypełniony niewyraźnymi kształtami drewnianej konstrukcji. Wrażeniem ogromnej wysokości.
links.belarusian: Запоўнены невыразнымі формамі драўлянай канструкцыі. Уражанне велізарнай вышыні.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You know, in the middle of the last..."
links.english: You know, in the middle of the last century, there was a group of Revacholian painters who famously disdained the use of black.
links.polish: Wiesz, w połowie zeszłego stulecia w działała grupa revacholskich malarzy, której członkowie słynęli ze swojej pogardy do korzystania z koloru czarnego.
links.belarusian: Вы ведаеце, у сярэдзіне мінулага стагоддзя дзейнічала група рэвашольскіх мастакоў, члены якой славіліся сваім пагардай да выкарыстання чорнага колеру.

links.title: You: "What did they have against black?"
links.english: What did they have against black?
links.polish: A co mieli przeciwko czarnemu?
links.belarusian: А што яны мелі супраць чорнага?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "They wanted to capture what it real..."
links.english: They wanted to capture what it really felt like to look at the world -- to be *inside* colour, to be blinded by early afternoon light glittering on the crests of sea waves.
links.polish: Chcieli ująć to, jakie wrażenia naprawdę towarzyszą oglądaniu świata. Jak to jest być *wewnątrz* koloru, być oślepionym przez światło popołudnia odbijające się od piany morskich fal.
links.belarusian: Яны хацелі перадаць, якія адчуванні сапраўды суправаджаюць назіранне за светам. Як гэта - быць *ўнутры* колеру, быць асляплёным святлом папярэдняга дня, якое адбіваецца ад пены марскіх хваляў.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Such an effect is best achieved by..."
links.english: Such an effect is best achieved by using the juxtaposition of complementary colours -- rather than the addition of black -- to create contrast.
links.polish: Taki efekt najlepiej osiąga się poprzez zestawianie komplementarnych kolorów w celu stworzenia kontrastu raczej niż dodawanie czerni.
links.belarusian: Такі эфект лепш за ўсё дасягаецца шляхам спалучэня камплементарных колераў для стварэння кантрасту, а не дадавання чорнага колеру.

links.title: You: "Sounds complicated."
links.english: Sounds complicated.
links.polish: Brzmi to skomplikowanie.
links.belarusian: Гэта гучыць складана.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It would likely be easier to explai..."
links.english: It would likely be easier to explain with a hands-on demonstration. Alas!
links.polish: Łatwiej chyba byłoby zademonstrować niż wyjaśnić. Niestety!
links.belarusian: Лягчэй, мабыць, было б прадэманстраваць, чым растлумачыць. На жаль!

links.title: You: "Seems unfair to black. I like black..."
links.english: Seems unfair to black. I like black, look at it!
links.polish: To brzmi niesprawiedliwie dla czerni. Lubię czerń. Patrz na nią!
links.belarusian: Гэта гучыць несправядліва да чорнага колеру. Мне падабаецца чорны. Глядзі на яго!

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Sometimes an encounter with an oppo..."
links.english: Sometimes an encounter with an opposing aesthetic is required for one to truly grow into one's tastes and preferences.
links.polish: Czasami trzeba zetknąć się z obcą dla siebie estetyką, aby prawdziwie ukształtować swoje gusta i preferencje.
links.belarusian: Часам трэба сутыкнуцца з чужой для сябе эстэтыкай, каб па-сапраўднаму сфармаваць свае густы і перавагі.

links.title: You: "Hmm, maybe I should take up paintin..."
links.english: Hmm, maybe I should take up painting.
links.polish: Hmmm, może powinienem spróbować malarstwa?
links.belarusian: Хмм, можа, мне варта паспрабаваць маляванне?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's unclear if you have enough yea..."
links.english: It's unclear if you have enough years left in you to make up for your lack of technique...
links.polish: Nie wiadomo tylko, czy zostało ci dosyć życia, żeby nadrobić braki w technice...
links.belarusian: Невядома толькі, ці засталося табе дастаткова жыцця, каб надолужыць недахопы ў тэхніцы...

links.title: You: "Why only Revacholian?"
links.english: Why only Revacholian?
links.polish: Czemu tylko revacholskich?
links.belarusian: Чаму толькі рэвашольскіх?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Revachol was an overwhelmingly colo..."
links.english: Revachol was an overwhelmingly colourful place back then. They made most of the world's dyes here.
links.polish: Revachol był wtedy niesamowicie kolorowym miejscem. Powstawała tu większość znanych na świecie barwników.
links.belarusian: Рэвашоль быў тады неверагодна каларытным месцам. Тут выраблялася большасць вядомых у свеце фарбавальнікаў.

links.title: You: "Can I use this to see through the d..."
links.english: Can I use this to see through the darkness up there, somehow? (Proceed.)
links.polish: Mogę wykorzystać tę wiedzę, żeby jakoś przebić się przez ten mrok na górze? (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: Я магу скарыстацца гэтай ведай, каб як-небудзь прабіцца праз гэты змрок уверсе? (Працягвай далей).

links.title: Encyclopedia: "No, this is just an intellectual mu..."
links.english: No, this is just an intellectual musing. In fact, it's probably dangerous to waste time like this. You should stop.
links.polish: Nie, to tylko takie rozmyślania. Prawdę mówiąc, takie marnowanie czasu jest zapewne niebezpieczne. Powinieneś przestać.
links.belarusian: Не, гэта проста такія разважанні. Калі шчыра, такое марнаванне часу, хутчэй за ўсё, небяспечнае. Табе трэба спыніцца.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's like you see your own face ref..."
links.english: It's like you see your own face reflected back at you in the vanishing geometry -- a strange, alien image that's supposed to be you.
links.polish: To jak widzieć swoją własną twarz odbijającą się w wykrzywionym zwierciadle. Dziwną, obcą aparycję, która rzekomo jest tobą.
links.belarusian: Гэта як бачыць сваё ўласнае аблічча, якое адбіваецца ў скрыўленым люстэрку. Дзіўную, чужую знешнасць, якая быццам належыць табе.

links.title: You: "Try to make out something -- anythi..."
links.english: Try to make out something -- anything.
links.polish: Spróbuj coś tam wypatrzeć. Cokolwiek.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуй нешта там заўважыць. Што заўгодна.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There's nothing. You're dizzy and d..."
links.english: There's nothing. You're dizzy and disoriented as you see dark and more dark -- rising...
links.polish: Nie ma nic. Kręci ci się w głowie i czujesz się otumaniony. Widzisz tylko mrok i jeszcze więcej mroku. Gęstniejącego...
links.belarusian: Няма нічога. Круціцца ў галаве і адчуваеш сябе ашаламоўным. Бачыш толькі цемру і яшчэ больш цемры. Гусцеючай...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, what are you looking at?"..."
links.english: "Officer, what are you looking at?" He follows your gaze, attempting to see whatever it is that you are seeing.
links.polish: „Oficerze, czemu się przyglądasz?” – pyta porucznik i podąża za twoim wzrokiem, próbując dostrzec to, co przykuło twoją uwagę.
links.belarusian: "Офіцэр, чаму ты глядзіш?" — пытаецца лейтэнант і сочыць за тваім позіркам, спрабуючы ўбачыць тое, што прыцягнула тваю ўвагу.

links.title: You: "(Blink.)"
links.english: (Blink.)
links.polish: (Mrugnij).
links.belarusian: (Міргнуць).

links.title: Tiago: "You see something hanging from the..."
links.english: You see something hanging from the rafters, looking straight at you with dark eyes.
links.polish: Widzisz coś zwisającego z krokwi, patrzącego na ciebie ciemnymi oczami.
links.belarusian: Вы бачыш нешта, што звісае з крокваў, і глядзіць на цябе цёмнымі вачыма.

links.title: Tiago: "Maybe it's possible to... talk to i..."
links.english: Maybe it's possible to... talk to it?
links.polish: Może dałoby się z tym... porozmawiać?
links.belarusian: Можа, атрымалася б з гэтым... пагаварыць?

links.title: You: "What if I don't *want* to know what..."
links.english: What if I don't *want* to know what's up there?
links.polish: A jeśli *nie chcę* wiedzieć, co jest tam na górze?
links.belarusian: А калі *не хачу* ведаць, што там наверсе?

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "The silence, the darkness -- they'v..."
links.english: The silence, the darkness -- they've enveloped you, as in a cocoon. You cannot move anymore.
links.polish: Cisza i mrok otoczyły cię niczym kokon. Nie jesteś się już w stanie ruszyć.
links.belarusian: Цішыня і цемра ахінулі цябе, як кокан. Ты ўжо не можаш рухацца.

links.title: Volition: "Relax. It'll be okay."
links.english: Relax. It'll be okay.
links.polish: Spokojnie. Wszystko będzie dobrze.
links.belarusian: Спакойна. Усё будзе добра.

links.title: You: "Look up into the bell tower."
links.english: Look up into the bell tower.
links.polish: Spójrz w górę, do wnętrza dzwonnicy.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі ўгару, усярэдзіну званіцы.
